reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: GPI: Regional Energy Procurement Assistance Program for the Caribbean

description.narrative: This award strives to advance freedom and dignity by assisting governments and citizens to establish, consolidate and protect democratic institutions, processes, and values, including participatory and accountable governance, rule of law, authentic political competition, civil society, human rights, and the free flow of information. More specifically, this includes This assistance provides funding for a Procurement Assistance Program with up to eight Caribbean countries under the U.S. Trade and Development Agency’s Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value, as part of the interagency Caribbean 2020 Initiative: A Multi-Year Strategy To Increase the Security, Prosperity, and Well-Being of the People of the United States and the Caribbean.. This assistance provides funding for a Procurement Assistance Program with up to eight Caribbean countries under the U.S. Trade and Development Agency’s Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value, as part of the interagency Caribbean 2020 Initiative: A Multi-Year Strategy To Increase the Security, Prosperity, and Well-Being of the People of the United States and the Caribbean (Caribbean 2020)..

To advance freedom and dignity by assisting governments and citizens to establish, consolidate and protect democratic institutions, processes, and values, including participatory and accountable governance, rule of law, authentic political competition, civil society, human rights, and the free flow of information.
